\section{TapeQualityInformation}
\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.tape_quality_information.TapeQualityInformation:tapequalityinformation}}\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.tape_quality_information.TapeQualityInformation::doc}}\index{TapeQualityInformation (class in quality\_assessment.tape\_quality\_information)@\spxentry{TapeQualityInformation}\spxextra{class in quality\_assessment.tape\_quality\_information}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.tape_quality_information.TapeQualityInformation:quality_assessment.tape_quality_information.TapeQualityInformation}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{quality\_assessment.tape\_quality\_information.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{TapeQualityInformation}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{data: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{tape\_id: str}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{expected\_average: float}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{averages: list{[}quality\_assessment.data\_types.AveragesInfo{]} = \textless{}factory\textgreater{}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{scattering: list{[}quality\_assessment.data\_types.ScatterInfo{]} = \textless{}factory\textgreater{}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{dropouts: list{[}quality\_assessment.data\_types.PeakInfo{]} = \textless{}factory\textgreater{}}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Class to collect information on quality features of HTS tapes
\begin{description}
\item[{data}] \leavevmode{[}DataFrame{]}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Critical current vs. position data of a HTS tape.

\item[{tape\_id: str}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
ID of the HTS tape

\item[{expected\_average}] \leavevmode{[}float{]}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Approximate average critical current. Used for drop\sphinxhyphen{}out detection and
piecewise average calculation.

\item[{averages}] \leavevmode{[}list{[}AveragesInfo{]} = {[}{]}{]}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Piecewise averages.

\item[{scattering: list{[}ScatterInfo{]} = {[}{]}}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
Piecewise scattering info (standard deviation).

\item[{dropouts}] \leavevmode{[}list{[}PeakInfo{]} = {[}{]}{]}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Information about all drop\sphinxhyphen{}outs.

\end{description}
\begin{description}
\item[{calculate\_statistics(TestType) \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} list{[}QualitityParameterInfo{]}}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
Calculates piecewise statistics info.

\item[{calculate\_drop\_out\_info() \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} list{[}QualitityParameterInfo{]}}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
Calculate drop\sphinxhyphen{}out information.

\end{description}

\subsection{DefectReportPDF.accept\_page\_break}
\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.accept_page_break:defectreportpdf-accept-page-break}}\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.accept_page_break::doc}}\index{accept\_page\_break (quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF property)@\spxentry{accept\_page\_break}\spxextra{quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF property}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.accept_page_break:quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.accept_page_break}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{property\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DefectReportPDF.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{accept\_page\_break}}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Whenever a page break condition is met, this method is called,
and the break is issued or not depending on the returned value.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The default implementation returns a value according to the mode selected by \sphinxtitleref{set\_auto\_page\_break()}.
This method is called automatically and should not be called directly by the application.

\end{fulllineitems}

{\hyperref[\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.arc:quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.arc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DefectReportPDF.arc}}}}}(x, y, a, start\_angle, ...)
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
Outputs an arc. It can be drawn (border only), filled (with no border) or both. a (float): Semi\sphinxhyphen{}major axis diameter. b (float): Semi\sphinxhyphen{}minor axis diameter, if None, equals to a (default: None). start\_angle (float): Start angle of the arc (in degrees). end\_angle (float): End angle of the arc (in degrees). inclination (float): Inclination of the arc in respect of the x\sphinxhyphen{}axis (default: 0). clockwise (bool): Way of drawing the arc (True: clockwise, False: counterclockwise) (default: False). start\_from\_center (bool): Start drawing from the center of the circle (default: False). end\_at\_center (bool): End drawing at the center of the circle (default: False). style (str): Style of rendering. Possible values are:         * \sphinxtitleref{D} or None: draw border. This is the default value. * \sphinxtitleref{F}: fill         * \sphinxtitleref{DF} or \sphinxtitleref{FD}: draw and fill.
\\

\subsection{DefectReportPDF.\_\_init\_\_}
\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.__init__:defectreportpdf-init}}\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.__init__::doc}}\index{\_\_init\_\_() (quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method)@\spxentry{\_\_init\_\_()}\spxextra{quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.__init__:quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.__init__}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DefectReportPDF.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_\_init\_\_}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{tape\_id}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{str}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{product}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{str}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{orientation}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{str}}}{}\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{orientation}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} possible values are “portrait” (can be abbreviated “P”)
or “landscape” (can be abbreviated “L”). Default to “portrait”.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{unit}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} possible values are “pt”, “mm”, “cm”, “in”, or a number.
A point equals 1/72 of an inch, that is to say about 0.35 mm (an inch being 2.54 cm).
This is a very common unit in typography; font sizes are expressed in this unit.
If given a number, then it will be treated as the number of points per unit.  (eg. 72 = 1 in)
Default to “mm”.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{format}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} possible values are “a3”, “a4”, “a5”, “letter”, “legal” or a tuple
(width, height) expressed in the given unit. Default to “a4”.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{font\_cache\_dir}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Path}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ or }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} {[}\sphinxstylestrong{DEPRECATED}{]} unused

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\subsection{DefectReportPDF.add\_font}
\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.add_font:defectreportpdf-add-font}}\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.add_font::doc}}\index{add\_font() (quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method)@\spxentry{add\_font()}\spxextra{quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.add_font:quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.add_font}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DefectReportPDF.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{add\_font}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{family}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{style}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}\textquotesingle{}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{fname}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{uni}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}DEPRECATED\textquotesingle{}}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Imports a TrueType or OpenType font and makes it available
for later calls to the \sphinxtitleref{set\_font()} method.

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Warning:} there is partial support for Type1 and legacy fonts in .pkl font definition files,
generated by the \sphinxtitleref{MakeFont} utility, but this feature is getting deprecated in favour of TrueType Unicode font support
(whose fonts are automatically processed with the included \sphinxtitleref{ttfonts.py} module).

\sphinxAtStartPar
You will find more information on the “Unicode” documentation page.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{family}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} font family. Used as a reference for \sphinxtitleref{set\_font()}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{style}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} font style. “B” for bold, “I” for italic.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{fname}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} font file name. You can specify a relative or full path.
If the file is not found, it will be searched in \sphinxtitleref{FPDF\_FONT\_DIR}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{uni}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} {[}\sphinxstylestrong{DEPRECATED}{]} unused

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}



\subsection{DefectReportPDF.add\_link}
\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.add_link:defectreportpdf-add-link}}\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.add_link::doc}}\index{add\_link() (quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method)@\spxentry{add\_link()}\spxextra{quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.add_link:quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.add_link}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DefectReportPDF.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{add\_link}}}{}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Creates a new internal link and returns its identifier.
An internal link is a clickable area which directs to another place within the document.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The identifier can then be passed to the \sphinxtitleref{cell()}, \sphinxtitleref{write()}, \sphinxtitleref{image()} or \sphinxtitleref{link()} methods.
The destination must be defined using \sphinxtitleref{set\_link()}.

\end{fulllineitems}



\subsection{DefectReportPDF.add\_page}
\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.add_page:defectreportpdf-add-page}}\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.add_page::doc}}\index{add\_page() (quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method)@\spxentry{add\_page()}\spxextra{quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.add_page:quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.add_page}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DefectReportPDF.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{add\_page}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{orientation}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}\textquotesingle{}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{format}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}\textquotesingle{}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{same}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{duration}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{0}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{transition}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Adds a new page to the document.
If a page is already present, the \sphinxtitleref{footer()} method is called first.
Then the page  is added, the current position is set to the top\sphinxhyphen{}left corner,
with respect to the left and top margins, and the \sphinxtitleref{header()} method is called.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{orientation}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} “portrait” (can be abbreviated “P”)
or “landscape” (can be abbreviated “L”). Default to “portrait”.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{format}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} “a3”, “a4”, “a5”, “letter”, “legal” or a tuple
(width, height). Default to “a4”.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{same}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} indicates to use the same page format as the previous page.
Default to False.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{duration}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} optional page’s display duration, i.e. the maximum length of time,
in seconds, that the page is displayed in presentation mode,
before the viewer application automatically advances to the next page.
Can be configured globally through the \sphinxtitleref{page\_duration} FPDF property.
As of june 2021, onored by Adobe Acrobat reader, but ignored by Sumatra PDF reader.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{transition}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Transition child class}}) \textendash{} optional visual transition to use when moving
from another page to the given page during a presentation.
Can be configured globally through the \sphinxtitleref{page\_transition} FPDF property.
As of june 2021, onored by Adobe Acrobat reader, but ignored by Sumatra PDF reader.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}



\subsection{DefectReportPDF.alias\_nb\_pages}
\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.alias_nb_pages:defectreportpdf-alias-nb-pages}}\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.alias_nb_pages::doc}}\index{alias\_nb\_pages() (quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method)@\spxentry{alias\_nb\_pages()}\spxextra{quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.alias_nb_pages:quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.alias_nb_pages}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DefectReportPDF.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{alias\_nb\_pages}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{alias}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}\{nb\}\textquotesingle{}}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Defines an alias for the total number of pages.
It will be substituted as the document is closed.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This is useful to insert the number of pages of the document
at a time when this number is not known by the program.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This substitution can be disabled for performances reasons, by caling \sphinxtitleref{alias\_nb\_pages(None)}.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{alias}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} the alias. Defaults to “\{nb\}”.

\end{description}\end{quote}
\subsubsection*{Notes}

\sphinxAtStartPar
When using this feature with the \sphinxtitleref{cell} / \sphinxtitleref{multicell} methods,
or the \sphinxtitleref{underline} attribute of \sphinxtitleref{FPDF} class,
the width of the text rendered will take into account the alias length,
not the length of the “actual number of pages” string,
which can causes slight positioning differences.

\end{fulllineitems}



\subsection{DefectReportPDF.arc}
\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.arc:defectreportpdf-arc}}\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.arc::doc}}\index{arc() (quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method)@\spxentry{arc()}\spxextra{quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.arc:quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.arc}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DefectReportPDF.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{arc}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{x}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{y}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{a}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{start\_angle}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{end\_angle}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{b}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{inclination}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{0}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{clockwise}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{start\_from\_center}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{end\_at\_center}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{style}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Outputs an arc.
It can be drawn (border only), filled (with no border) or both.
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
a (float): Semi\sphinxhyphen{}major axis diameter.
b (float): Semi\sphinxhyphen{}minor axis diameter, if None, equals to a (default: None).
start\_angle (float): Start angle of the arc (in degrees).
end\_angle (float): End angle of the arc (in degrees).
inclination (float): Inclination of the arc in respect of the x\sphinxhyphen{}axis (default: 0).
clockwise (bool): Way of drawing the arc (True: clockwise, False: counterclockwise) (default: False).
start\_from\_center (bool): Start drawing from the center of the circle (default: False).
end\_at\_center (bool): End drawing at the center of the circle (default: False).
style (str): Style of rendering. Possible values are:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{D} or None: draw border. This is the default value.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{F}: fill

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{DF} or \sphinxtitleref{FD}: draw and fill

\end{itemize}
\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}



\subsection{DefectReportPDF.cell}
\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.cell:defectreportpdf-cell}}\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.cell::doc}}\index{cell() (quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method)@\spxentry{cell()}\spxextra{quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.cell:quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.cell}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DefectReportPDF.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{cell}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{w}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{h}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{txt}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}\textquotesingle{}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{border}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{0}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{ln}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{0}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{align}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}\textquotesingle{}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{fill}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{link}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}\textquotesingle{}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{center}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{markdown}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Prints a cell (rectangular area) with optional borders, background color and
character string. The upper\sphinxhyphen{}left corner of the cell corresponds to the current
position. The text can be aligned or centered. After the call, the current
position moves to the right or to the next line. It is possible to put a link
on the text.

\sphinxAtStartPar
If automatic page breaking is enabled and the cell goes beyond the limit, a
page break is performed before outputting.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{w}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} Cell width. Default value: None, meaning to fit text width.
If 0, the cell extends up to the right margin.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{h}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} Cell height. Default value: None, meaning an height equal
to the current font size.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{txt}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} String to print. Default value: empty string.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{border}} \textendash{} Indicates if borders must be drawn around the cell.
The value can be either a number (\sphinxtitleref{0}: no border ; \sphinxtitleref{1}: frame)
or a string containing some or all of the following characters
(in any order):
\sphinxtitleref{L}: left ; \sphinxtitleref{T}: top ; \sphinxtitleref{R}: right ; \sphinxtitleref{B}: bottom. Default value: 0.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ln}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Indicates where the current position should go after the call.
Possible values are: \sphinxtitleref{0}: to the right ; \sphinxtitleref{1}: to the beginning of the
next line ; \sphinxtitleref{2}: below. Putting 1 is equivalent to putting 0 and calling
\sphinxtitleref{ln} just after. Default value: 0.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{align}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} Allows to center or align the text inside the cell.
Possible values are: \sphinxtitleref{L} or empty string: left align (default value) ;
\sphinxtitleref{C}: center ; \sphinxtitleref{R}: right align

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{fill}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} Indicates if the cell background must be painted (\sphinxtitleref{True})
or transparent (\sphinxtitleref{False}). Default value: False.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{link}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} optional link to add on the cell, internal
(identifier returned by \sphinxtitleref{add\_link}) or external URL.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{center}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} center the cell horizontally in the page

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{markdown}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} enable minimal markdown\sphinxhyphen{}like markup to render part
of text as bold / italics / underlined. Default to False.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Returns: a boolean indicating if page break was triggered

\end{fulllineitems}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Outputs an ellipse.
It can be drawn (border only), filled (with no border) or both.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{w}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} Width.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{h}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} Height.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{style}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} Style of rendering. Possible values are:
* \sphinxtitleref{D} or empty string: draw border. This is the default value.
* \sphinxtitleref{F}: fill
* \sphinxtitleref{DF} or \sphinxtitleref{FD}: draw and fill

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\subsection{DefectReportPDF.image}
\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.image:defectreportpdf-image}}\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.image::doc}}\index{image() (quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method)@\spxentry{image()}\spxextra{quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.image:quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.image}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DefectReportPDF.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{image}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{name}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{x}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{y}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{w}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{0}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{h}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{0}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{type}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}\textquotesingle{}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{link}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}\textquotesingle{}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{title}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{alt\_text}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Put an image on the page.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The size of the image on the page can be specified in different ways:
* explicit width and height (expressed in user units)
* one explicit dimension, the other being calculated automatically
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
in order to keep the original proportions
\end{quote}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
no explicit dimension, in which case the image is put at 72 dpi.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Remarks}:
* if an image is used several times, only one copy is embedded in the file.
* when using an animated GIF, only the first frame is used.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{name}} \textendash{} either a string representing a file path to an image, an URL to an image,
an io.BytesIO, or a instance of \sphinxtitleref{PIL.Image.Image}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{x}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} optional horizontal position where to put the image on the page.
If not specified or equal to None, the current abscissa is used.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{y}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} optional vertical position where to put the image on the page.
If not specified or equal to None, the current ordinate is used.
After the call, the current ordinate is moved to the bottom of the image

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{w}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} optional width of the image. If not specified or equal to zero,
it is automatically calculated from the image size.
Pass \sphinxtitleref{pdf.epw} to scale horizontally to the full page width.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{h}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} optional height of the image. If not specified or equal to zero,
it is automatically calculated from the image size.
Pass \sphinxtitleref{pdf.eph} to scale horizontally to the full page height.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{type}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} {[}\sphinxstylestrong{DEPRECATED}{]} unused, will be removed in a later version.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{link}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} optional link to add on the image, internal
(identifier returned by \sphinxtitleref{add\_link}) or external URL.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{title}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} optional. Currently, never seem rendered by PDF readers.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{alt\_text}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} optional alternative text describing the image,
for accessibility purposes. Displayed by some PDF readers on hover.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}



\subsection{DefectReportPDF.insert\_toc\_placeholder}
\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.insert_toc_placeholder:defectreportpdf-insert-toc-placeholder}}\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.insert_toc_placeholder::doc}}\index{insert\_toc\_placeholder() (quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method)@\spxentry{insert\_toc\_placeholder()}\spxextra{quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.insert_toc_placeholder:quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.insert_toc_placeholder}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DefectReportPDF.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{insert\_toc\_placeholder}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{render\_toc\_function}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{pages}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{1}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Configure Table Of Contents rendering at the end of the document generation,
and reserve some vertical space right now in order to insert it.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{render\_toc\_function}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{function}}) \textendash{} a function that will be invoked to render the ToC.
This function will receive 2 parameters: \sphinxtitleref{pdf}, an instance of FPDF, and \sphinxtitleref{outline},
a list of \sphinxtitleref{OutlineSection}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{pages}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} the number of pages that the Table of Contents will span,
including the current one that will. As many page breaks as the value of this argument
will occur immediately after calling this method.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\subsection{DefectReportPDF.link}
\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.link:defectreportpdf-link}}\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.link::doc}}\index{link() (quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method)@\spxentry{link()}\spxextra{quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.link:quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.link}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DefectReportPDF.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{link}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{x}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{y}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{w}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{h}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{link}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{alt\_text}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Puts a link annotation on a rectangular area of the page.
Text or image links are generally put via {[}cell{]}(\#fpdf.FPDF.cell),
{[}write{]}(\#fpdf.FPDF.write) or {[}image{]}(\#fpdf.FPDF.image),
but this method can be useful for instance to define a clickable area inside an image.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{x}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} horizontal position (from the left) to the left side of the link rectangle

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{y}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} vertical position (from the top) to the bottom side of the link rectangle

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{w}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} width of the link rectangle

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{h}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} width of the link rectangle

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{link}} \textendash{} either an URL or a integer returned by \sphinxtitleref{add\_link}, defining an internal link to a page

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{alt\_text}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} optional textual description of the link, for accessibility purposes

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}



\subsection{DefectReportPDF.ln}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Line Feed.
The current abscissa goes back to the left margin and the ordinate increases by
the amount passed as parameter.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{h}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} The height of the break.
By default, the value equals the height of the last printed cell.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}



\subsection{DefectReportPDF.local\_context}
\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.local_context:defectreportpdf-local-context}}\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.local_context::doc}}\index{local\_context() (quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method)@\spxentry{local\_context()}\spxextra{quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.local_context:quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.local_context}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DefectReportPDF.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{local\_context}}}{}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Create a local grapics state, which won’t affect the surrounding code.
This method must be used as a context manager using \sphinxtitleref{with}:
\begin{quote}
\begin{description}
\item[{with pdf.local\_context():}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
set\_some\_state()
draw\_some\_stuff()

\end{description}
\end{quote}
\begin{description}
\item[{The affected settings are:}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
draw\_color
fill\_color
text\_color
underline
font\_style
font\_stretching
font\_family
font\_size\_pt
font\_size
dash\_pattern
line\_width

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}



\subsection{DefectReportPDF.multi\_cell}
\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.multi_cell:defectreportpdf-multi-cell}}\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.multi_cell::doc}}\index{multi\_cell() (quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method)@\spxentry{multi\_cell()}\spxextra{quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.multi_cell:quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.multi_cell}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DefectReportPDF.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{multi\_cell}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{w}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{h}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{txt}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}\textquotesingle{}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{border}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{0}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{align}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}J\textquotesingle{}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{fill}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{split\_only}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{link}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}\textquotesingle{}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{ln}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{0}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{max\_line\_height}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{markdown}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{print\_sh}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This method allows printing text with line breaks. They can be automatic
(breaking at the most recent space or soft\sphinxhyphen{}hyphen character) as soon as the text
reaches the right border of the cell, or explicit (via the \sphinxtitleref{n} character).
As many cells as necessary are stacked, one below the other.
Text can be aligned, centered or justified. The cell block can be framed and
the background painted.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{w}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} cell width. If 0, they extend up to the right margin of the page.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{h}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} cell height. Default value: None, meaning to use the current font size.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{txt}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} strign to print.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{border}} \textendash{} Indicates if borders must be drawn around the cell.
The value can be either a number (\sphinxtitleref{0}: no border ; \sphinxtitleref{1}: frame)
or a string containing some or all of the following characters
(in any order):
\sphinxtitleref{L}: left ; \sphinxtitleref{T}: top ; \sphinxtitleref{R}: right ; \sphinxtitleref{B}: bottom. Default value: 0.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{align}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} Allows to center or align the text. Possible values are:
\sphinxtitleref{J}: justify (default value); \sphinxtitleref{L} or empty string: left align ;
\sphinxtitleref{C}: center ; \sphinxtitleref{R}: right align

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{fill}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} Indicates if the cell background must be painted (\sphinxtitleref{True})
or transparent (\sphinxtitleref{False}). Default value: False.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{split\_only}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} if \sphinxtitleref{True}, does not output anything, only perform
word\sphinxhyphen{}wrapping and return the resulting multi\sphinxhyphen{}lines array of strings.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{link}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} optional link to add on the cell, internal
(identifier returned by \sphinxtitleref{add\_link}) or external URL.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ln}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Indicates where the current position should go after the call.
Possible values are: \sphinxtitleref{0}: to the bottom right ; \sphinxtitleref{1}: to the beginning
of the next line ; \sphinxtitleref{2}: below with the same horizontal offset ;
\sphinxtitleref{3}: to the right with the same vertical offset. Default value: 0.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{max\_line\_height}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} optional maximum height of each sub\sphinxhyphen{}cell generated

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{markdown}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} enable minimal markdown\sphinxhyphen{}like markup to render part
of text as bold / italics / underlined. Default to False.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{print\_sh}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} Treat a soft\sphinxhyphen{}hyphen (u00ad) as a normal printable
character, instead of a line breaking opportunity. Default value: False

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Using \sphinxtitleref{ln=3} and \sphinxtitleref{maximum height=pdf.font\_size} is useful to build tables
with multiline text in cells.
\begin{description}
\item[{Returns: a boolean indicating if page break was triggered,}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
or if \sphinxtitleref{split\_only == True}: \sphinxtitleref{txt} splitted into lines in an array

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Output PDF to some destination.
The method first calls {[}close{]}(close.md) if necessary to terminate the document.

\sphinxAtStartPar
By default the bytearray buffer is returned.
If a \sphinxtitleref{name} is given, the PDF is written to a new file.

\item {}

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\subsection{DefectReportPDF.rotation}
\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.rotation:defectreportpdf-rotation}}\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.rotation::doc}}\index{rotation() (quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method)@\spxentry{rotation()}\spxextra{quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.rotation:quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.rotation}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DefectReportPDF.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{rotation}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{angle}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{x}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{y}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This method allows to perform a rotation around a given center.
It must be used as a context\sphinxhyphen{}manager using \sphinxtitleref{with}:
\begin{quote}
\begin{description}
\item[{with rotation(angle=90, x=x, y=y):}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
pdf.something()

\end{description}
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The rotation affects all elements which are printed inside the indented
context (with the exception of clickable areas).
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{angle}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} angle in degrees

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{x}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} abscissa of the center of the rotation

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{y}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} ordinate of the center of the rotation

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}
\subsubsection*{Notes}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Only the rendering is altered. The \sphinxtitleref{get\_x()} and \sphinxtitleref{get\_y()} methods are
not affected, nor the automatic page break mechanism.
The rotation also establishes a local graphics state, so that any
graphics state settings changed within will not affect the operations
invoked after it has finished.

\end{fulllineitems}

\subsection{DefectReportPDF.set\_compression}
\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.set_compression:defectreportpdf-set-compression}}\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.set_compression::doc}}\index{set\_compression() (quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method)@\spxentry{set\_compression()}\spxextra{quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.set_compression:quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.set_compression}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DefectReportPDF.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{set\_compression}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{compress}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Activates or deactivates page compression.

\sphinxAtStartPar
When activated, the internal representation of each page is compressed
using the zlib/deflate method (FlateDecode), which leads to a compression ratio
of about 2 for the resulting document.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Page compression is enabled by default.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{compress}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} indicates if compression should be enabled

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\subsection{DefectReportPDF.set\_display\_mode}
\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.set_display_mode:defectreportpdf-set-display-mode}}\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.set_display_mode::doc}}\index{set\_display\_mode() (quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method)@\spxentry{set\_display\_mode()}\spxextra{quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.set_display_mode:quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.set_display_mode}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DefectReportPDF.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{set\_display\_mode}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{zoom}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{layout}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}continuous\textquotesingle{}}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Defines the way the document is to be displayed by the viewer.

\sphinxAtStartPar
It allows to set tje zoom level: pages can be displayed entirely on screen,
occupy the full width of the window, use the real size,
be scaled by a specific zooming factor or use the viewer default (configured in its Preferences menu).

\sphinxAtStartPar
The page layout can also be specified: single page at a time, continuous display, two columns or viewer default.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{zoom}} \textendash{} either “fullpage”, “fullwidth”, “real”, “default”,
or a number indicating the zooming factor to use, interpreted as a percentage.
The zoom level set by default is “default”.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{layout}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} either “single”, “continuous”, “two” or “default”,
meaning to use the viewer default mode.
The layout set by default is “default”,
and this method default value is “continuous”.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

Defines the color used for all stroking operations (lines, rectangles and cell borders).

The method can be called before the first page is created and the value is retained from page to page.

Else, this indicates the grey level. The value must be between 0 and 255.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{b}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} blue component (between 0 and 255)

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\subsection{DefectReportPDF.set\_font}
\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.set_font:defectreportpdf-set-font}}\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.set_font::doc}}\index{set\_font() (quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method)@\spxentry{set\_font()}\spxextra{quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.set_font:quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.set_font}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DefectReportPDF.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{set\_font}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{family}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{style}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}\textquotesingle{}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{size}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{0}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Sets the font used to print character strings.
It is mandatory to call this method at least once before printing text.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Default encoding is not specified, but all text writing methods accept only
unicode for external fonts and one byte encoding for standard.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Standard fonts use \sphinxtitleref{Latin\sphinxhyphen{}1} encoding by default, but Windows
encoding \sphinxtitleref{cp1252} (Western Europe) can be used with
\sphinxtitleref{self.core\_fonts\_encoding = encoding}.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The font specified is retained from page to page.
The method can be called before the first page is created.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{family}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} name of a font added with \sphinxtitleref{FPDF.add\_font},
or name of one of the 14 standard “PostScript” fonts:
Courier (fixed\sphinxhyphen{}width), Helvetica (sans serif), Times (serif),
Symbol (symbolic) or ZapfDingbats (symbolic)
If an empty string is provided, the current family is retained.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{style}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} empty string (by default) or a combination
of one or several letters among B (bold), I (italic) and U (underline).
Bold and italic styles do not apply to Symbol and ZapfDingbats fonts.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{size}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} in points. The default value is the current size.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\subsection{DefectReportPDF.set\_lang}
\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.set_lang:defectreportpdf-set-lang}}\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.set_lang::doc}}\index{set\_lang() (quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method)@\spxentry{set\_lang()}\spxextra{quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.set_lang:quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.set_lang}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DefectReportPDF.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{set\_lang}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{lang}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A language identifier specifying the natural language for all text in the document
except where overridden by language specifications for structure elements or marked content.
A language identifier can either be the empty text string, to indicate that the language is unknown,
or a Language\sphinxhyphen{}Tag as defined in RFC 3066, “Tags for the Identification of Languages”.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{lang}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} the document main language

\end{description}\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.solid_arc:defectreportpdf-solid-arc}}\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.solid_arc::doc}}\index{solid\_arc() (quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method)@\spxentry{solid\_arc()}\spxextra{quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.solid_arc:quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.solid_arc}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DefectReportPDF.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{solid\_arc}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{x}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{y}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{a}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{start\_angle}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{end\_angle}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{b}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{inclination}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{0}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{clockwise}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{style}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Outputs a solid arc. A solid arc combines an arc and a triangle to form a pie slice
It can be drawn (border only), filled (with no border) or both.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{x}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} Abscissa of upper\sphinxhyphen{}left bounging box.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{y}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} Ordinate of upper\sphinxhyphen{}left bounging box.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{a}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} Semi\sphinxhyphen{}major axis.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{b}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} Semi\sphinxhyphen{}minor axis, if None, equals to a (default: None).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{start\_angle}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} Start angle of the arc (in degrees).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{end\_angle}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} End angle of the arc (in degrees).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{inclination}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} Inclination of the arc in respect of the x\sphinxhyphen{}axis (default: 0).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{clockwise}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} Way of drawing the arc (True: clockwise, False: counterclockwise) (default: False).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{style}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} Style of rendering. Possible values are:
* \sphinxtitleref{D} or None: draw border. This is the default value.
* \sphinxtitleref{F}: fill
* \sphinxtitleref{DF} or \sphinxtitleref{FD}: draw and fill

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\subsection{DefectReportPDF.text}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Prints a character string. The origin is on the left of the first character,
on the baseline. This method allows placing a string precisely on the page,
but it is usually easier to use the \sphinxtitleref{cell()}, \sphinxtitleref{multi\_cell() or \textasciigrave{}write()} methods.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{y}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} ordinate of the origin

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{txt}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} string to print

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\subsection{DefectReportPDF.unbreakable}
\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.unbreakable:defectreportpdf-unbreakable}}\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.unbreakable::doc}}\index{unbreakable() (quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method)@\spxentry{unbreakable()}\spxextra{quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.unbreakable:quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.unbreakable}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DefectReportPDF.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{unbreakable}}}{}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Ensures that all rendering performed in this context appear on a single page
by performing page break beforehand if need be.
\subsubsection*{Notes}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Using this method means to duplicate the FPDF \sphinxtitleref{bytearray} buffer:
when generating large PDFs, doubling memory usage may be troublesome.

\end{fulllineitems}

\subsection{DefectReportPDF.write}
\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.write:defectreportpdf-write}}\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.write::doc}}\index{write() (quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method)@\spxentry{write()}\spxextra{quality\_assessment.quality\_pdf\_report.DefectReportPDF method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.write:quality_assessment.quality_pdf_report.DefectReportPDF.write}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DefectReportPDF.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{write}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{h}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{float}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{txt}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{str}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}\textquotesingle{}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{link}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{str}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}\textquotesingle{}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{print\_sh}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{bool}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{False}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Prints text from the current position.
When the right margin is reached, a line break occurs at the most recent
space or soft\sphinxhyphen{}hyphen character, and text continues from the left margin.
A manual break happens any time the n character is met,
Upon method exit, the current position is left just at the end of the text.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{h}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} line height. Default value: None, meaning to use the current font size.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{txt}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} text content

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{link}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} optional link to add on the text, internal
(identifier returned by \sphinxtitleref{add\_link}) or external URL.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{print\_sh}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} Treat a soft\sphinxhyphen{}hyphen (u00ad) as a normal printable
character, instead of a line breaking opportunity. Default value: False

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}

\section{QualityParameterInfo}
\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.data_types.QualityParameterInfo:qualityparameterinfo}}\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.data_types.QualityParameterInfo::doc}}\index{QualityParameterInfo (class in quality\_assessment.data\_types)@\spxentry{QualityParameterInfo}\spxextra{class in quality\_assessment.data\_types}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/quality_assessment.data_types.QualityParameterInfo:quality_assessment.data_types.QualityParameterInfo}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{quality\_assessment.data\_types.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{QualityParameterInfo}}}{\emph{\DUrole{o}{*}\DUrole{n}{args}}, \emph{\DUrole{o}{**}\DUrole{n}{kwargs}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Protocol for defect information
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
p\_id (int): ID of the defect
start\_position (float): Start position of the defect.
end\_position (float): End position of the defect.
center\_position (float): Center position of the defect.
width (float): Width of the defect section.
value (float): Value of the defect.
description (str): Description of the defect information
\end{quote}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Tuple holding information about tape specifications
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
width (float): Tape width in mm
min\_tape\_length (float): Minimum tape length for product in m
min\_value (float): Minimum value in A
dropout\_value (Optional{[}float{]}): Minimum drop\sphinxhyphen{}out value in A
dropout\_func (Optional{[}Callable{[}{[}float{]}, float{]}{]}): Maximum width of drop\sphinxhyphen{}out in mm
min\_average (Optional{[}float{]}): Minimum average value in A
average\_length (Optional{[}float{]}): Length over which to average in m
description (str): Name/Description of the product
\end{quote}
